intro: Phebalium ambiens, commonly known as the broad-leafed hakea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a silvery underside, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Phebalium ambiens is valued in horticulture for its drought tolerance and ability to attract native pollinators.
